text:
10 useful features of the Files app in iOS
02 Nov 2019, 16:30 by Artyom Surovtsev
The Files application, since its introduction in iOS, has been an incomprehensible likeness of a file manager. Only in iOS 13, developers began to reveal the potential of the utility, adding several important and useful features to it.
Now I‚Äôll tell you about ten file manager chips on the iPhone, for which you need to download the application.
1. You can store any type of file



The main feature of the application is the ability to store any type of file, even those that cannot be opened in any application on the smartphone.
So the iPhone can act as a temporary storage of data and it is easy to use it as a wireless flash drive using AirDrop.
Just for the sake of such an opportunity, you should keep the Files application on your device, it will come in handy.
2. The application has a built-in archiver



The second most important feature is the built-in archiver. Without additional manipulations and applications, you can open the resulting archive or pack the necessary data.
At the current data transfer speed and storage volumes, file compression does not give a tangible effect, but transferring and storing one archive instead of hundreds of files is always more convenient.
You just need to pinch the file until the context menu appears and select Compress to add to the archive or Unzip to unzip.
3. Through the program, you can access iCloud



The easiest way to get files from the Apple cloud on the iPhone is to use the native file manager.
You will immediately see all the folders and files from the cloud and you can download the necessary data to your smartphone.
If at the same time on the Mac you enable the storage of documents and files from the desktop in the cloud (System Settings - Apple ID - iCloud - Documents), then on the iPhone you can always see all the working files from these folders.
4. Conveniently share files from iCloud



Directly from the application, you can share any data from your cloud and manage file permissions.
To configure access rights, do the following:
‚ñ∏ open the desired iCloud folder in the Files application
‚ñ∏ click Select and mark the data you want to give access to
‚ñ∏ in the Share menu, find the Add Users item
‚ñ∏ add users and viewing or editing rights
The link to the file can be sent by mail or through the messenger.
5. You can connect other clouds



In addition to the native iCloud cloud, the Files application works well with other cloud storage services. Most of the popular services have long been finalized by their customers and you will not have to configure anything manually.
Press the button with three dots in the upper right corner and add the connection to the desired cloud. Of course, the corresponding client must be installed on the iPhone.
6. The application is convenient to store confidential photos



One of the iOS chips is the ability to hide some photos from the Photos app. They will have to be stored in the Files application.
We talked about the work of the chips in detail in this article.
From the file manager, you can get a good viewer of photos and videos, while confidential data will not ‚Äúflash‚Äù in the standard gallery.
7. The program has tags and search



IOS developers tried to transfer useful features from the Finder file manager on Mac to the Photo application.
One of the innovations is tag support. You can color-mark any data so that you can quickly find all the marked files in the future.
Tags will be saved when transferring the file from iPhone to Mac and vice versa.
Do not forget about the convenient search. In the line, you can enter not only part of the name of the file you are looking for, but also its extension or creation date.
8. Files - storage for downloads from Safari and mail



The mobile browser in iOS 13 learned to download any data from the network without problems and crutches. All downloaded files will be stored in the Files application.
It is also convenient to place saved attachments from mail here. No need to re-save them in editing programs or cloud storage.
9. There is support for external drives



In iOS 13, Apple's mobile gadgets have learned to fully work with external drives. Of course, the Files application is useful for viewing data on a USB flash drive or memory card.
With its help, you can not only view the data, but also copy, cut and paste them in the right place.
Almost full management of files and folders without jailbreak. You only need to purchase the appropriate adapter.
10. View files in columns and quick actions (iPad only)



Apple tablets this fall received a lot of exclusive chips that are not on the iPhone. Cupertinos even renamed the operating system for tablets to iPadOS.
The Files application, in which two options were added for the iPad, was no exception.
The first option is to view files in the form of columns. A fairly convenient way to manage files that have long been used by all owners of Mac computers.
The second feature is quick actions with common file types right in the application. For example, special buttons are provided for rotating a photo or converting a picture to PDF.
This is how you can use the Files app on your iPhone or iPad with iOS 13.
